intro: Rubus hirtus var. foliosus, commonly known as the hairy blackberry or bramble, is a perennial shrub native to North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that ripen to a dark purple or black color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Its botanical features make it a common species in woodland and disturbed habitats.
